Source_Event_IDs.description: All original event IDs from various sources (e.g., EMDAT 'DisNo.'). If only one source provides an ID, this array will have a single string.

Event_Name.description: An array of event names from different sources (e.g., 'Event Name'). If sources differ, all unique names are retained.

Event_Type.description: An array of event types (e.g., 'Disaster Type'). If sources differ, all unique variations are retained.

Country.description: An array of country names. If multiple sources differ, all unique names are retained.

Country_Code.description: An array of ISO country codes (e.g., 'ISO'). If multiple sources differ, all unique codes are retained.

Location.description: List of sub-national locations or admin areas. If multiple sources differ, all are included.

Latitude.description: Array of latitude values. If multiple coordinates differ, all are included.

Longitude.description: Array of longitude values. If multiple coordinates differ, all are included.

Date.description: ISO 8601 formatted date-time (mapped from 'Entry Date'). If sources differ, you may store one or eventually keep multiple values.

Year.description: Year extracted from the event date (e.g., 'Start Year'). If multiple years differ, you may store one or convert to an array if needed.

Month.description: Month extracted from the event date (e.g., 'Start Month'). Similar considerations as Year.

Day.description: Day extracted from the event date (e.g., 'Start Day'). Similar considerations as Year.

Severity.description: Severity indicators (e.g., 'Magnitude') from different sources, stored as an array of strings.

Population_Affected.description: Number of people affected (e.g., 'No. Affected'). A single integer derived from multiple sources if needed.

Fatalities.description: Number of fatalities (e.g., 'Total Deaths'). A single integer decided after consolidation.

AID_Contribution.description: Approved amount of financial aid contributed (e.g., 'AID Contribution (\'000 US$)').

Admin_Units.description: Administrative units affected by the disaster (e.g., 'Admin Units').

External_IDs.description: External IDs from various sources for cross-referencing events (e.g., 'External IDs').
